security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation files with TypeScript code examples. No executable code, network calls, credential access, or data exfiltration patterns detected. All content serves as reference material for Payload CMS development.

content.user_title: Build type-safe Payload CMS applications with confidence
content.value_statement: Payload CMS development requires understanding many patterns across collections, fields, hooks, and access control. This skill provides instant reference for all Payload patterns and security best practices.
actual_capabilities: Provides complete field type reference with validation and admin options
Documents collection patterns including auth, upload, and versioning
Explains hook patterns for beforeChange, afterRead, and transaction safety
Covers access control patterns from basic RBAC to multi-tenant setups
Includes query examples for Local API, REST, and GraphQL
limitations: Does not execute code or interact with Payload instances directly
Reference material only - cannot modify your actual project files
Examples may need adaptation for specific project configurations

use_cases.title: Configure collection access control
use_cases.description: Set up role-based permissions, row-level security, and field-level access for your Payload collections.

use_cases.title: Build custom hooks and endpoints
use_cases.description: Create beforeChange hooks, afterRead transformations, and custom API endpoints with proper transaction handling.

use_cases.title: Develop Payload CMS plugins
use_cases.description: Follow best practices for plugin architecture including field injection, hook composition, and admin UI components.

prompt_templates.title: Basic collection setup
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I create a Posts collection with title, slug, content, and author relationship fields?

prompt_templates.title: Access control patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement access control where users can only edit their own posts but admins can edit any post.

prompt_templates.title: Hook implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I create a beforeChange hook that auto-generates a slug from the title and sets publishedAt when status changes to published?

prompt_templates.title: Plugin development
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the pattern for creating a Payload plugin that adds SEO fields to specified collections with tabbed UI support?

output_examples.input: How do I set up row-level access control for a multi-tenant app?
output: Create a tenant field on your collection with required: true
Add an access control function that returns a query constraint filtering by tenant
Use a beforeChange hook to auto-set the tenant from the logged-in user
Protect the tenant field so only super-admins can modify it
Remember to set overrideAccess: false when using Local API with user context

best_practices: Always pass req to nested operations in hooks to maintain transaction atomicity
Set overrideAccess: false when passing a user to Local API operations
Use context flags to prevent infinite loops in hooks that trigger updates
anti_patterns: Passing user to Local API without overrideAccess: false bypasses all permissions
Omitting req in hook operations breaks transaction rollback on errors
Calling update inside afterChange without context check creates infinite loops

faq.question: Which Payload CMS versions does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill covers Payload 3.x patterns which uses Next.js native architecture with React Server Components.

faq.question: What database adapters are covered?
faq.answer: Documentation includes MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and SQLite adapter configuration with transaction patterns for each.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing Payload projects?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides reference patterns you can apply to any Payload 3.x project regardless of setup.

faq.question: Does this skill access my project files or database?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides documentation only. It does not execute code or access your files.

faq.question: What if my Payload queries return unexpected results?
faq.answer: Check that you set overrideAccess: false when passing user context and verify your access control returns proper query constraints.

faq.question: How does this compare to official Payload documentation?
faq.answer: This skill distills patterns from official docs into quick-reference format optimized for AI-assisted development workflows.
